00022 /*
00023  ATTENTION!
00024  If you would like a :
00025  -- a utility that will handle the caching of fft objects
00026  -- real-only (no imaginary time component ) FFT
00027  -- a multi-dimensional FFT
00028  -- a command-line utility to perform ffts
00029  -- a command-line utility to perform fast-convolution filtering
00030 
00031  Then see kfc.h kiss_fftr.h kiss_fftnd.h fftutil.c kiss_fastfir.c
00032   in the tools/ directory.
00033 */
00034 
00035 #ifdef USE_SIMD
00036 # include <xmmintrin.h>
00037 # define kiss_fft_scalar __m128
00038 #define KISS_FFT_MALLOC(nbytes) memalign(16,nbytes)
00039 #else   
00040 #define KISS_FFT_MALLOC malloc
00041 #endif  
00042 
00043 
00044 #ifdef FIXED_POINT
00045 #include <sys/types.h>  
00046 # if (FIXED_POINT == 32)
00047 #  define kiss_fft_scalar int32_t
00048 # else  
00049 #  define kiss_fft_scalar int16_t
00050 # endif
00051 #else
00052 # ifndef kiss_fft_scalar
00053 /*  default is float */
00054 #   define kiss_fft_scalar double
00055 # endif
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 typedef struct {
00059     kiss_fft_scalar r;
00060     kiss_fft_scalar i;
00061 }kiss_fft_cpx;
00062 
00063 typedef struct kiss_fft_state* kiss_fft_cfg;
00064 
00065 /* 
00066  *  kiss_fft_alloc
00067  *  
00068  *  Initialize a FFT (or IFFT) algorithm's cfg/state buffer.
00069  *
00070  *  typical usage:      kiss_fft_cfg mycfg=kiss_fft_alloc(1024,0,NULL,NULL);
00071  *
00072  *  The return value from fft_alloc is a cfg buffer used internally
00073  *  by the fft routine or NULL.
00074  *
00075  *  If lenmem is NULL, then kiss_fft_alloc will allocate a cfg buffer using malloc.
00076  *  The returned value should be free()d when done to avoid memory leaks.
00077  *  
00078  *  The state can be placed in a user supplied buffer 'mem':
00079  *  If lenmem is not NULL and mem is not NULL and *lenmem is large enough,
00080  *      then the function places the cfg in mem and the size used in *lenmem
00081  *      and returns mem.
00082  *  
00083  *  If lenmem is not NULL and ( mem is NULL or *lenmem is not large enough),
00084  *      then the function returns NULL and places the minimum cfg 
00085  *      buffer size in *lenmem.
00086  * */
00087 
00088 kiss_fft_cfg kiss_fft_alloc(int nfft,int inverse_fft,void * mem,size_t * lenmem); 
00089 
00090 /*
00091  * kiss_fft(cfg,in_out_buf)
00092  *
00093  * Perform an FFT on a complex input buffer.
00094  * for a forward FFT,
00095  * fin should be  f[0] , f[1] , ... ,f[nfft-1]
00096  * fout will be   F[0] , F[1] , ... ,F[nfft-1]
00097  * Note that each element is complex and can be accessed like
00098     f[k].r and f[k].i
00099  * */
00100 void kiss_fft(kiss_fft_cfg cfg,const kiss_fft_cpx *fin,kiss_fft_cpx *fout);
00101 
00102 /*
00103  A more generic version of the above function. It reads its input from every Nth sample.
00104  * */
00105 void kiss_fft_stride(kiss_fft_cfg cfg,const kiss_fft_cpx *fin,kiss_fft_cpx *fout,int fin_stride);
00106 
00107 /* If kiss_fft_alloc allocated a buffer, it is one contiguous 
00108    buffer and can be simply free()d when no longer needed*/
00109 #define kiss_fft_free free
00110 
00111 /*
00112  Cleans up some memory that gets managed internally. Not necessary to call, but it might clean up 
00113  your compiler output to call this before you exit.
00114 */
00115 void kiss_fft_cleanup(void);
00116

00118 #ifdef __cplusplus
00119 }
